name: Sheraton Gunter Hotel San Antonio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton Gunter over the July 28th, 2012 weekend and must say that it far, far exceeded my expectations. I have been in SPG hotels for over 100 nights in 2012 and this is the one that surprised me the most.
reviews.title: Terrific Stay- Top Notch Staff- Incredible Value

reviews.text: Check In
reviews.title: Perfect for Rest & Relaxation!

reviews.text: Beautiful lobby and historic. The architecture was quite nice and not what I expected out of a Category 2 hotel. This was closer to a Category 4. Check in was quick and painless. We had a bellman get our bags out of the car and he waited as we parked across the street at a parking garage before walking us to the room. Quick Tip- Valet is $28/day but there is a parking garage 50 yards away from the hotel that was $9. Very easy to get to if you are going to be walking and not going in and out.
reviews.title: Nightmare checkin once again.

reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Great hotel for vacation or business travels

reviews.text: We had a corner room that was not the standard one, but not a suite. Very spacious, though not the best use of space (there was a big empty spot in the middle of the room). Bathroom was a bit smallish, but all in all, a nice setup. Wooden blinds, large room, nice amenities. Again, this was closer to a Level 4, not Level 2 hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous all around!!

reviews.text: good location but needs some help... the location is within walking distance to most things you want to do in San Antonio. The lobby ceiling is very nice but the rest is just plain average. The club floor food seems like to all comes out of a box... free wine and beer though.
reviews.title: good location but needs some help

reviews.text: My bathroom was really old and could use a nice redo. The bathroom was as clean as it could possible be for it's age... it is time for a remodel.
reviews.title: Great Location especially if you have kids!!

reviews.text: They need to do something with the room doors as you constantly hear them being opened and closed.
reviews.title: Heeeeere's Johnny!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, this is a Sheraton but keep in mind is a below average one. Service was fine but overall would not stay here again... I am Starwood Platinum Member
reviews.title: Very Classy

reviews.text: This was our second time to stay at the Sheraton Gunter. Upon arrival valet was quick and were equally as fast the three times we had to access our car. Check-In was easy and fast. The best part for us about this hotel is that you only have to walk a block to the riverwalk but do not have all of the noise that the riverwalk can sometimes bring. Additionally it is only about 4 doors away from the Childrens Museum which is one of the main reasons we go to the Riverwalk. It is also a very short walk to the Alamo. It seems that we can get to everything that the kids want to do and without having to load up the car or get exhausted walking in the heat. The staff is so nice and the breakfast at Barrons is wonderful. There are so many great things about this hotel. I will agree with other reviewers that the bathrooms are small but seriously who is spending their time in the hotel in the bathroom?? Highly recommend and we will of course be back next year!!
reviews.title: Dirty and old

reviews.text: Great hotel. Excellent customer service. Specially, on the Club level. Harriet did a great job both at breakfast and then in the early evening.
reviews.title: River Walk and Fiesta Texas Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks Harriet.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay and a Wonderful Location to See All the Sights!

reviews.text: Location was also great to access the river without being on the river.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff & Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regards
reviews.title: Historic and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoy staying at the Sheraton Gunter very much! This was our second stay there in the past few weeks. The rooms are excellent and all of the staff have been great. Your Front Desk Manager has been accommodating in every way. San Antonio is a great city to visit with beautiful old buildings, Cathedrals, the River Walk, the Alamo, Markets and great restaurants. The best part, everything is within walking distance of the Gunter. The Gunter is a classic hotel with an excellent, attentive staff. The rooms are spacious. The bathrooms are a bit dated, but everything was clean and neat. We will definitely stay there again soon.
reviews.title: Restuarant and Bar Service Slow

reviews.text: Our day was not going particularly well when we arrived at the Gunther. Chris at the front desk told us that our vacation was going to turn around now that we were there. He upgraded us to the club level and also gave us the best deal we could have imagined. He truly turned our vacation around. The staff were professional and curteous and made our stay special. I highly recommend the Sheraton Gunther. Thanks Chris!!!
reviews.title: Professional Service

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights on a business trip. Wonderfully maintained and very up to date, even though it is a historic hotel. Front Desk upgraded my room to club level at no additional charge because of my Starwood Preferred membership. Will definitely be staying here on my next trip to San Antonio.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Staff, and Value

reviews.text: The Sheraton Gunter San Antonio staff is to be commended on their hospitality. Make no mistake - they take the word "accommodating" seriously. Everyone on staff was so friendly and helpful. From the time I made my reservation to when we checked out, all the Gunter team really went out of their way to accommodate us. We would most definitely stay again. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Keep up the good work, Gunter!
reviews.title: Gunter Hotel - Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: I was there 7-16-12 for only one night. The hotel is wonderfully restored better than original. The room was not small as many restored hotel rooms seem to be. While most hotels are not known for good food, the breakfast buffet was excellent. There was a large selection of fresh fruit and the quality of the food was above average. The most pleasant surprise was the attentive staff at the front desk and in the Club Lounge. The check-in and check-out experience was exceptional. They actually made me feel like they were glad to have my business. The riverwalk is just a block away and there is no reason to need a car. This is now my favorite hotel in San Antonio.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent service, convenient: Sheraton Gunter

reviews.text: This is an awesome hotel with an historic background and a great start to visiting the historic sights in San Antonio. I personally give it all 5 stars however because there was not free wifi in the room or a microwave which are amenities my son has grown accustom to I had to drop one. The staff here are EXCELLENT and the beds are very comfortable. It is close to both the Riverwalk and the Market and the walk around the area includes many beautiful historical buildings with magnificant architecture. Great place to be in San Antonio and we plan on returning again this summer a couple of times. It also was not a bad or far drive to Sea World.
reviews.title: Historic Gunther Hotel San Antonio

description: Embrace history and timeless design at the Sheraton Gunter Hotel San Antonio. 13 conference rooms and Grand Ballroom. Our flexible space can accommodate up to 500 guests.
